address.addressline: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Betsy Pittman in March 2011.

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.repository: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center.
did.abstract: The collection contains correspondence, school papers, memorabilia, photographs and ephemera associated with two generations of the Collins and Levine families who attended the University of Connecticut between 1922 and 1948.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Eli Ives Collins (Class of 1925) worked on the student newspaper while attending Connecticut Agricultural College. After leaving college, Collins had a successful career as a newspaper reporter and editor, primarily for the Jersey Journal in Jersey City, N.J.
Edward R. Collins (Class of 1928) and Frances F. Schreiber (Class of 1927) met as students attending the Connecticut Agricultural College and married in 1927.

Donald I. Levine (Class of 1949) and member of Phi Epsilon Pi married Laura Ann Collins (Class of 1949), a member of Kappa Alpha Theta. They were married in Stamford, Connecticut, in 1952. Their daughter, Deborah Ann Levine, entered the University in 1971 and obtained multiple degrees. While at the University, she met Jonathan B. Chaires, who received a Ph.D. in biophysics from the University. They married in 1981.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains correspondence, school papers, memorabilia, photographs and ephemera associated with two generations of the Collins and Levine families who attended the University of Connecticut between 1922 and 1948. The materials in the collection are useful in providing a perspective of college life and experiences from the student's point of view.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged chronologically by individual.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to the University, its history, administration, faculty, staff and students. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Multiple issues of the Connecticut Campus (1921-1928) have been added to the Archives' holdings of the Connecticut Daily Campus.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This record series is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on this collection.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The materials were saved and collected by the two generations of Collins and Levine family members who had attended the University of Connecticut

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], Collins-Levine Family Papers. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were donated by Adam Levine in 2011.
